title: An Arab Leading a Camel
medium: black crayon on buff colored paper
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Alexandre-Gabriel Decamps [1803-1860], Paris, France. Seiferheld and Co., New York, NY [1]; Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ, by June 12, 1974 [2]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1975.

Notes:
[1]. The Gallery's label was affixed on the back of the frame. Several other works in the Fishkoff collection have also passed through the Seiferheld gallery in NYC, which was active throughout the 1960s under various names.
[2]. Daniel and Jane Fishkoff loaned the work to the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute in June 1974; see curatorial file for original loan form and list of works.

creator.birth_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
